Detailed Description

The DynamicPyramidSwarm incorporates detection and response mechanisms for dynamic environments.

The DynamicPyramidSwarm consists of a PyramidSwarm and several scouts that monitor the environment

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DynamicPyramidSwarm::DynamicPyramidSwarm ( PSO *  pso_p,
int  size,
int  dim,
double  min_x,
double  max_x,
double  min_v,
double  max_v,
int  height,
int  branches,
int  swapDelay,
int  nrScouts 
)

Constructor for H-PSO, setting up the swarm and arranging it in a pyramid shape.

Parameters:
pso_p  The PSO Algorithm for the parameters used
size  The number of birds to create the PyramidSwarm
dim  The dimension of the search space, i.e. the function to be optimized
min_x  Lower bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
max_x  Upper bound of x dimension, x0 chosen randomly
min_v  Lower bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
max_v  Upper bound of v dimension, v0 chosen randomly
height  The height (levels) of the pyramid
branches  How many successors there are on the level below
swapDelay  A swap is only allowed every swapDelay steps
nrScouts  The number of birds for the scouting swarm

Member Function Documentation

bool DynamicPyramidSwarm::isDivided (  )  [inline, virtual]

Return whether the swarm is currently divided.

Reimplemented from Swarm.

int DynamicPyramidSwarm::step ( int  steps = 1  )  [protected, virtual]

The pyramidswarm does steps steps.

Within one iteration the following actions are done for all the birds.
The current position is evaluated, within each neighbourhood the iteration best bird is determined and compared to the bird above, the arrangment is adjusted - the best bird per neighbourhood moves up one level, the current velocity is adjusted to the global best bird and the birds are moved.

Reimplemented from PyramidSwarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void DynamicPyramidSwarm::dividedHierarchicalCompare (  )  [protected]

According to the pyramid hierarchy the birds are compared and swapped within the respective sub-swarm.

Each bird is compared to its direct children and is swapped with the best sibling, if this one is better than the upper level node. This is done on each side of the dividing line at divisionDepth.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void DynamicPyramidSwarm::dividedUpdateVel (  )  [protected]

The velocities of the birds are updated within the respective sub-swarm.

The children of each node update their velocity with their parent node as global best. This is done on each side of the dividing line at divisionDepth.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void DynamicPyramidSwarm::randomizeSubSwarms ( bool  reset,
bool  randomizeTopSwarm 
) [protected]

The lower sub-swarms are re-randomized.

The leader of the lower sub-swarms is re-randomized (random position and random velocity

Parameters:
reset The rest of the lower sub-swarms is reset (forget personal best)
randomizeTopSwarm For SubSwarms*MergeNoMemory

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool DynamicPyramidSwarm::detectDynamicChange (  )  [protected, virtual]

Apply detection method for changed environment.

Depending on detectionMethod it is checked for a change in the evalutation function. The scoutDetectChange method can be used here.

Returns:
True if the environment changed.

Reimplemented from Swarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void DynamicPyramidSwarm::respondToChange (  )  [protected, virtual]

Respond to the change in the environment.

If the responseMethod dividePyramid is selected, several pyramid connections are separated and no swaps are possible. Otherwise Swarm::respondToChange is called

Reimplemented from Swarm.

Here is the call graph for this function:

Member Data Documentation

int DynamicPyramidSwarm::divisionDepth [protected]

Sub-swarms are created by introducing a dividing line.

Particles at divisionDepth (root is depth 0) no longer receive update from their predecessors and they cannot swap upwards.

bool DynamicPyramidSwarm::dividedSwarm [protected]

The swarm is still divided.

int DynamicPyramidSwarm::divisionDuration [protected]

The duration of the division, for a duration based division.

map<int, int> DynamicPyramidSwarm::gbestInSubswarm [protected]

Dictionary for counting where gbest is in the divided swarm.

If the swarm is divided, the count is increased for the subswarm that gbest belonged to
